message.content:
After someone enters the room and kills one of the three killers, there will be 2 killers left in the room. 

The task is to determine how many killers remain after the event described.

Initially, we have three killers present in the room.

Then, a person enters the room and kills one of the three killers. This reduces the number of killers by one.

To calculate the remaining number of killers, subtract 1 from the initial count: 3 - 1 = 2.

Thus, there will be 2 killers left in the room after one is killed.
